# Test Cases

**Generated by requirements-gathering-agent v2.1.3**  
**Category:** quality-assurance  
**Generated:** 2025-06-19T08:38:40.536Z  
**Description:** Detailed test cases and test scenarios

---

## Test Cases Documentation for ADPA (Automated Documentation Project Assistant)

**1. Test Case Overview**

* **Purpose and Scope:**  These test cases verify the functionality, usability, performance, security, and reliability of the ADPA tool, covering all aspects from document generation to integration with various AI providers and version control.
* **Test Case Naming Conventions:**  `TC_[Area]_[Functionality]_[Scenario]_[ID]`  (e.g., `TC_Functional_DocumentGeneration_ProjectCharter_001`)
* **Test Case Categories and Priorities:** Functional, UI, Integration, Performance, Security, Negative, Regression. Priorities: Critical, High, Medium, Low.
* **Traceability to Requirements:** Each test case will explicitly reference the relevant functional requirement(s) from the project documentation.  Requirements will be referenced using their ID (e.g., FR-1, FR-2, etc.  from the provided `02_REQUIREMENTS_MANAGEMENT_PLAN.MD`).


**2. Functional Test Cases**

| Test Case ID | Test Case Title                               | Objective                                                                     | Preconditions                                                              | Test Steps                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | Expected Results                                                                                                  | Test Data                                                                 | Priority | Requirements Traceability |
|--------------|-----------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------|--------------------------|
| TC_Functional_DocumentGeneration_ProjectCharter_001 | Generate Project Charter                               | Verify generation of a valid Project Charter document.                     | ADPA installed and configured; valid README.md file provided.              | 1. Run ADPA with the `--generate-with-validation` flag. <br> 2. Verify the existence of `generated-documents/project-charter/ProjectCharter.md`. <br> 3. Review the generated Project Charter for completeness and accuracy against PMBOK standards. | Project Charter document generated; complete and accurate; PMBOK compliant;  Validation report shows successful validation. | README.md with basic project information (title, description, goals, stakeholders) | High     | FR-1, FR-6              |
| TC_Functional_DocumentGeneration_StakeholderRegister_002 | Generate Stakeholder Register                           | Verify generation of a valid Stakeholder Register document.               | ADPA installed and configured; README.md file with stakeholder information. | 1. Run ADPA with the `--generate-stakeholder` flag. <br> 2. Verify the existence of `generated-documents/stakeholder-management/StakeholderRegister.md`. <br> 3. Review the generated Stakeholder Register for completeness and accuracy. | Stakeholder Register document generated; complete and accurate; includes all stakeholders mentioned in README.md. | README.md with stakeholder information (name, role, contact)                  | High     | FR-2                    |
| TC_Functional_APIIntegration_AzureOpenAI_003         | Test Azure OpenAI Integration                          | Verify successful integration with Azure OpenAI.                        | ADPA configured with valid Azure OpenAI credentials.                    | 1. Run ADPA with Azure OpenAI as the provider. <br> 2. Monitor logs for successful API calls. <br> 3. Verify document generation using Azure OpenAI. | Documents generated successfully using Azure OpenAI; logs show successful API calls.                        | README.md with sufficient content; valid Azure OpenAI credentials.            | Critical | FR-3                    |
| TC_Functional_MultiProviderSupport_004              | Test Multiple AI Provider Support                     | Verify ability to switch between multiple AI providers.                   | ADPA configured with credentials for multiple providers (e.g., Azure OpenAI, Google AI). | 1. Configure ADPA for Azure OpenAI. Generate a document.<br>2. Configure ADPA for Google AI. Generate the same document.<br>3. Compare the generated documents. | Documents generated successfully using both providers; minor variations in output are acceptable (due to different LLM capabilities). | README.md; valid credentials for multiple providers.                       | Medium   | FR-7                    |
| TC_Functional_VersionControl_005                    | Test Version Control System                              | Verify the functionality of the built-in version control system.           | ADPA configured to use VCS; documents generated at least twice.           | 1. Generate documents. <br> 2. Generate documents again with changes in the README.md. <br> 3. Use `requirements-gathering-agent vcs log` and `requirements-gathering-agent vcs diff` to check version history and differences. | Version history is correctly tracked; diffs show changes accurately; VCS commands work as expected.                | README.md with multiple versions of content.                               | High     | FR-7                    |

| TC_UI_CLI_Help_001                  | Verify CLI Help Functionality             | Verify that the CLI help command displays correct information.          | ADPA installed.                                      | Run `requirements-gathering-agent -h` or `requirements-gathering-agent --help`.                               | Help information displayed correctly, including all options and descriptions. | N/A                                   | Medium   |
| TC_UI_CLI_Version_002                | Verify CLI Version Functionality           | Verify that the CLI version command displays the correct version number. | ADPA installed.                                      | Run `requirements-gathering-agent -v` or `requirements-gathering-agent --version`.                           | Correct version number displayed.                                                | N/A                                   | Medium   |
| TC_UI_CLI_InvalidCommand_003          | Handle Invalid CLI Commands              | Verify that the CLI handles invalid commands gracefully.                | ADPA installed.                                      | Run `requirements-gathering-agent invalid-command`.                                                         | Appropriate error message displayed; program exits gracefully.                   | Invalid command                               | Low     |
| TC_UI_CLI_OptionCombination_004     | Verify Option Combination Handling       | Verify that the CLI correctly handles combinations of options.           | ADPA installed.                                      | Run `requirements-gathering-agent --core-only --with-retry --validate-pmbok`.                               | Documents generated as specified by options; correct error handling.             | Various combinations of CLI options | Medium   |

|--------------|----------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------|----------|

| TC_Performance_ResourceUtilization_002 | Test Resource Utilization            | Monitor CPU, memory, and disk I/O usage during document generation.          | ADPA deployed in a test environment; monitoring tools configured.              | Generate documents and monitor resource usage.                                                                                                                            | Resource utilization remains within acceptable thresholds.                                                 | Various document generation scenarios.                 | Medium   |


**6. Security Test Cases**

| Test Case ID | Test Case Title                     | Objective                                                                    | Preconditions                                                                     | Test Steps                                                                                                                                                                                | Expected Results                                                                                                             | Test Data                                                              | Priority |
|--------------|--------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------|----------|
| TC_Security_Authentication_001         | Test Authentication Mechanisms          | Verify that only authorized users can access and use ADPA.                  | ADPA deployed; user accounts created.                                             | Attempt to access ADPA without valid credentials; attempt to access with valid credentials.                                                                                             | Access denied without valid credentials; access granted with valid credentials.                                                                    | Valid and invalid credentials                                    | Critical |
| TC_Security_InputValidation_002       | Test Input Validation                  | Verify that ADPA handles invalid inputs securely.                             | ADPA deployed.                                                                | Provide various invalid inputs (e.g., SQL injection attempts, cross-site scripting attempts) to ADPA.                                                                                | ADPA handles invalid inputs securely without vulnerabilities; appropriate error messages are displayed.                                                                 | Various invalid inputs (SQL injection, XSS, etc.)      | High     |
| TC_Security_DataProtection_003        | Test Data Protection                    | Verify that sensitive data (API keys, etc.) is protected.                    | ADPA deployed.                                                                | Review the codebase for secure handling of sensitive data.                                                                                                                            | Sensitive data is stored and handled securely; no hardcoded credentials; appropriate encryption used where necessary. | N/A                                                   | Critical |


**7. Negative Test Cases**

| Test Case ID | Test Case Title                               | Objective                                                                  | Preconditions                                                   | Test Steps                                                                                                                                                           | Expected Results                                                                                                  | Test Data                                            | Priority |
|--------------|-----------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------|----------|
| TC_Negative_InvalidInput_001           | Handle Invalid README.md                  | Verify that ADPA handles invalid or missing README.md files gracefully.   | ADPA installed.                                           | Run ADPA without a README.md file; run with a malformed README.md file.                                                                                     | Appropriate error messages displayed; program exits gracefully; no crashes.                                           | Missing or malformed README.md files.                    | High     |
| TC_Negative_MissingCredentials_002      | Handle Missing Provider Credentials       | Verify that ADPA handles missing provider credentials appropriately.       | ADPA installed.                                           | Run ADPA without configuring any AI provider credentials.                                                                                                     | Appropriate error messages displayed; program exits gracefully; no crashes.                                           | No provider credentials configured.                       | High     |
| TC_Negative_APIError_003               | Handle API Errors                         | Verify that ADPA gracefully handles errors from the AI provider APIs.        | ADPA installed and configured; intentionally introduce network issues. | Generate documents while simulating an API error (network outage, rate limiting).                                                                                          | Appropriate error messages displayed; program attempts retry; fallback mechanisms work; no data corruption.     | Network issues simulating API errors.                 | High     |


**8. Regression Test Cases**

Regression testing will be performed after each code change or bug fix.  These tests will re-run a subset of the above test cases to ensure that previously working functionality remains unaffected. The specific test cases selected for regression testing will depend on the nature of the code change.


**9. Test Data Requirements**

* **Specific Data Sets:**  Test data will include various README.md files with different levels of complexity, including valid and invalid data, edge cases, and boundary conditions.
* **Data Setup and Cleanup:**  Test data will be created and managed using scripts to ensure consistency and reproducibility.  Cleanup procedures will be implemented to remove test data after execution.
* **Test Data Privacy and Security:**  Sensitive data (API keys, etc.) will be stored securely and will not be hardcoded into test scripts.  Environment variables will be used.
* **Data Generation:**  Test data can be generated using automated scripts to create various scenarios.


**10. Test Case Execution Guidelines**

* **Execution Order and Dependencies:**  Test cases can generally be run independently, except for those with explicit dependencies (e.g., setup/teardown).
* **Environment Prerequisites:**  A consistent test environment (OS, Node.js version, AI provider APIs) must be established before test execution.
* **Test Result Documentation:**  Test results will be documented in a clear and concise manner, including pass/fail status, actual results, and any relevant logs or screenshots.
* **Defect Reporting Procedures:**  Defects will be logged using a standardized defect tracking system, including detailed descriptions, steps to reproduce, and expected/actual results.


This detailed test plan provides a comprehensive framework for testing the ADPA tool.  The actual test execution will require adapting the test data and environment to the specific context of the testing phase.  This comprehensive approach ensures thorough testing across all functionalities and aspects of the ADPA tool.
